author: Special Correspondent
text:
The re-laying of concrete road in progress at Kadukkamaram area on the hill station of Yercaud in Salem district.

The State Highways Department has converted a stretch of the loop road at Kadukkamaram area on the hill station of Yercaud into a concrete road to avoid water seepage.

The seepage of water from both embankment on the main ghat road leading to the tribal villages of Pattipadi, Velur, Nagalur Muluvi and Karadiyur from Yercaud town frequently led to disruption of traffic.

The Highways Department laid concrete road to a length of 60 m on late Friday evening.

The official sources said that as undertaking the project manually will delay the execution work, ready concrete mix was used to complete the road laying work quickly.

The regular vehicular movement was stopped on this road during the night hours to enable the completion of this work, the source said.

The laying of concrete road will put permanent end to the water seepage problem and disruption of traffic on this main road, the sources added.
title: Concrete road comes up at Kadukkamaram area
